channel.title: [PI] c.isBanking Problems
channel.description: Simple problem that I can't figure out. Problem is, after I open up the bank and then try to trade, I get the message "You can't trade while banking!" I opened up my Trade.java and it says [code=java] if (c.isBanking) {[/code] What I have attempted was making [code=java]c.isBanking = true;[/code] to [code=java]c.isBanking = !c.isBanking;[/code] in the openUpBank void in PlayerAssistant.java. I also tried a [code=java]} else { c.isBanking = false;[/code] in the openUpBank void and still get the problem. Help please. I am confused.

item.title: [PI] c.isBanking Problems
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

I tried this one. public void flushOutStream() { if (disconnected || outStream.currentOffset == 0) return; // synchronized(this) { StaticPacketBuilder out = new StaticPacketBuilder().setBare(true); byte[] temp = new byte[outStream.currentOffset]; System.arraycopy(outStream.buffer, 0, temp, 0, temp.length); out.addBytes(temp); session.write(out.toPacket()); outStream.currentOffset = 0; // } } Still dosen’t work. FUCK THESE NEW PI’S!!!

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] c.isBanking Problems
item.dc:creator: @fasthop10 fasthop10
item.description:
@fasthop10 wrote:

try replacing it lol i can get u one that does work just a sec

	public void flushOutStream() {	
		if(disconnected || outStream.currentOffset == 0) return;
		synchronized(this) {	
			StaticPacketBuilder out = new StaticPacketBuilder().setBare(true);
			byte[] temp = new byte[outStream.currentOffset]; 
			System.arraycopy(outStream.buffer, 0, temp, 0, temp.length);
			out.addBytes(temp);
			session.write(out.toPacket());
			outStream.currentOffset = 0;
		}
       }

thats wht i got in mine and i know it works. try replacing with that.

Read full topic

item.description:
@fasthop10 wrote:

umm simple fix, find the button id of the [x] on the bank window , add c.isBanking = false; under it in clicking buttons.

if that dont work. just try removing the isBanking check to :tradereq: to find just search for the message u get when u try to trade.

then just try to backtrack and find the problem from there.
